page.title: 06Village of Sampford Spiney
page.content: The village ofsampford Spiney has a population of about 120 people. Downfield Cottages, originally four, now reduced to three were built for workers in the granite quarries, now obsolete. There is an old farmhouse, Eastontown, now a private residence with a much older one behind it, Warne's Kitchen, now used as a store. Nearby is an old farm, Gee's Eastontown, of about 60 acres, mostly used for store cattle. The old Manor Farm is close to the church (1250 AD)and a modern house is nearby. Holetown Farm owns land running down to the River Walkham, some of it woodland. The old Rectory, now called Southtown, is a private residence. Just below is Stoneycroft, a large granite built house, built at the turn of the century.
